intro: Oxytropis barkolensis, commonly known as the Mongolian locoweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with erect, branching stems covered in stiff, glandular hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis barkolensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and displaying resilience to drought conditions.
